Antonio Marino

Home About Projects Experience Contact

Experience

Researcher

Meta 2023 - Present

Working on training LLM agents for long-horizon tasks using reinforcement learning. Developing novel approaches for agent coordination and task decomposition in complex environments.

  • Designed and implemented RL algorithms for training language model agents
  • Developed evaluation frameworks for long-horizon task performance
  • Collaborated with cross-functional teams on agent coordination research

PyTorch Contributor

Meta (PyTorch Team) 2022 - 2023

Core contributor to PyTorch's reinforcement learning ecosystem, creating tools and frameworks for multi-agent reinforcement learning research.

  • Created BenchMARL, a comprehensive benchmarking library for MARL
  • Contributed key components to TorchRL for multi-agent systems
  • Developed environment interfaces and training infrastructure
  • Collaborated with open-source community on RL library development

PhD Researcher

University of Cambridge - Prorok Lab 2021 - 2025

Conducted research on heterogeneity in multi-agent and multi-robot systems, developing novel algorithms that leverage Graph Neural Networks for improved coordination.

  • Developed VMAS, a vectorized multi-agent simulator used by researchers worldwide
  • Published research on heterogeneous multi-agent reinforcement learning
  • Applied Graph Neural Networks to multi-agent coordination problems
  • Supervised undergraduate and master's students in research projects

MPhil Student

University of Cambridge 2020 - 2021

Completed Master of Philosophy in Advanced Computer Science with distinction, focusing on transport network design for multi-agent routing.

  • Investigated optimization algorithms for transport network topology
  • Developed novel approaches to multi-agent routing problems
  • Applied graph theory and optimization techniques to real-world scenarios

Publications

Heterogeneous Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning with Graph Neural Networks

Antonio Marino, et al. | Proceedings of ICML 2024

VMAS: A Vectorized Multi-Agent Simulator for Collective Robotics

Antonio Marino, et al. | Proceedings of IROS 2023

BenchMARL: A Benchmarking Suite for Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning

Antonio Marino, et al. | NeurIPS 2023 Workshop

Awards & Recognition

  • Outstanding PhD Research Award, University of Cambridge (2024)
  • Best Paper Award, IROS Multi-Robot Systems Workshop (2023)
  • PyTorch Community Contributor Award (2023)
  • Cambridge Computer Laboratory PhD Scholarship (2021-2025)
